intro: Cistanthe calycina, commonly known as the velvetleaf cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Cistanthe calycina is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in areas with limited water availability.
